title: Looking down on London at Christmas
description: One photographer has been capturing the capital from a helicopter - and shares his festive results.

title: Ukraine war: Zelensky delivers defiant Christmas message after Russian strikes
description: President Zelensky urges his people to persevere as Russian attacks leave millions without power.

title: Dog starts house fire after turning on hairdryer
description: Crews were called to Hockley, Essex, on Christmas Eve and treated the dog and owner at the scene.

title: Cardiff: Volunteers give up Christmas Day to feed care leavers
description: Volunteers are spending their day with care leavers to ensure they are not alone this Christmas.

title: Wales' archbishops mourn the Queen in first joint Christmas message
description: Wales' Anglican and Catholic archbishops have issued a joint Christmas message for the first time.

title: World Cup: Watch and vote for the best tournament this century
description: Watch highlights from each World Cup this century and vote for which you think was the best one.

title: Prince Harry and Megan criticise the Sun's Jeremy Clarkson apology
description: A spokesperson for the royal couple says the newspaper profited off "hate, violence and misogyny".

title: Fantasy football: How should managers shake up their teams with unlimited transfers?
description: Fantasy Premier League returns on Monday - and unlimited transfers during the break have give managers a golden opportunity to shake up their squads.

title: Are you in business?, Rishi Sunak asks homeless man during shelter visit
description: The prime minister has been criticised by some Labour MPs after his chat with homeless man goes viral online.

title: Quiz: How many memorable sporting moments from 2022 do you recall?
description: The year 2022 has had lots of memorable sporting moments but how many do you recall? Take the BBC Sport Christmas quiz to find out.

title: Faithless lead singer Maxi Jazz dies aged 65
description: Maxi Jazz, lead singer of British dance act Faithless, dies aged 65

title: Hearts rescue point but lose injured Gordon
description: Lawrence Shankland's late penalty saves a draw for Hearts against Dundee United, in a game marred by a serious injury to Scotland keeper Craig Gordon

title: Premiership Rugby: Leicester 28-13 Gloucester: Anthony Watson scores twice as Leicester beat Gloucester
description: Richard Wigglesworth wins his first match as interim head coach at Leicester as they beat Gloucester 28-8.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban bans women from working for NGOs
description: The latest restriction from Afghanistan's Islamist rulers says women are breaking strict dress codes.

title: Kyogo & Hatate inspire Celtic to win over St Johnstone
description: Reo Hatate and Kyogo Furuhashi claim a brace each as Celtic ease by St Johnstone to regain a nine-point lead at the summit of the Scottish Premiership.

title: Gemma Bonner: Liverpool re-sign WSL-winning captain
description: Liverpool re-sign Gemma Bonner, who captained the side to two WSL titles in her first spell at the club.

title: 'Serious medical incident' involving child at Center Parcs resort
description: Police say officers were called to the Center Parcs leisure complex at Longleat at 11:00 GMT.

title: Paris shooting: Protests after deadly attack on Kurds
description: Protesters clash with police following Friday's shootings, which killed three people.

title: South East Water supply problems persist on Christmas Eve
description: After a widespread thaw caused burst pipes, the company says it is still fixing leaks.

title: Lionel Messi & Paris Saint-Germain reach 'agreement in principle' to renew contract - Guillem Balague
description: Argentina captain Lionel Messi reaches an "agreement in principle" to renew his contract at Paris St-Germain says BBC Sport's Guillem Balague.

title: Scuba diving Santa makes waves in Florida
description: Father Christmas had an elfin hand from one of his festive team as he took part in a charity fundraiser.

title: Afghanistan protests: Taliban use water cannon on women opposing university ban
description: Women in Afghanistan are protesting against the Taliban's ban on female students attending university.

title: Rob Burrow's wheelchair accessible van vandalised in Castleford
description: The Rugby League star's father says it happened while the family were out for a Christmas meal.

title: Bethlehem sees Christmas tourism boost after two-year Covid hiatus
description: Thousands are expected to visit the Palestinian town, where the economy was badly hit by lockdowns.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Strikes on Kherson kill seven
description: At least seven people are killed and dozens injured in Russian air strikes on the recently liberated city.

title: Premier League: State of play as English top flight returns after World Cup
description: As the Premier League returns following the World Cup break, BBC Sport brings you up to speed on where it left off.

title: Mark Ormrod MBE: Triple amputee makes swimming record attempt
description: Former Royal Marine Mark Ormrod lost both his legs and his right arm in an Afghanistan bomb blast.

title: Vote: British boxer of the year - Tyson Fury and Natasha Jonas in contention
description: It's time to pick your British boxer of the year with world champions Tyson Fury and Natasha Jonas in contention.

title: Thomas Frank: Brentford manager signs new five-year contract until 2027
description: Thomas Frank signs a new five-year contract at Brentford until the summer of 2027.

title: Brixton Academy crush: Gaby Hutchinson's partner wants answers
description: The partner of Gaby Hutchinson says "someone must be held accountable" for what happened that night.

title: Nottingham maternity review: Coping with baby loss at Christmas
description: Families tell of how Christmas is a time when they reflect on their loved ones who have died.

title: Iran protests: Activist Narges Mohammadi details 'abuse' of detained women
description: Narges Mohammadi writes to the BBC with fellow inmates' accounts of physical and sexual abuse.

title: Ben Stokes, T20 World Cup win, Nat Sciver - 10 memorable moments for English cricket in 2022
description: Jonny Bairstow's 77-ball ton? The T20 World Cup win? Look back on the most memorable moments for England's men and women in 2022.

title: Premier League festive predictions: Chris Sutton faces singer and West Ham fan Chesney Hawkes
description: Chris Sutton takes on singer and West Ham fan Chesney Hawkes to pick his winners and losers from the festive Premier League games.

title: Can Wolves turn Premier League season around under new boss Julen Lopetegui?
description: Wolvers insiders have been impressed by Julen Lopetegui's start off the pitch, but can he guide them to Premier League survival?

title: Reunited: The Ukrainian couple who married near the front line
description: Video of Lesya and Valeriy's military checkpoint wedding went viral in March 2022.

title: At least 20 dead in Russia illegal care home fire
description: Another six people are injured after the blaze in an unregistered property in the Siberian city of Kemerovo.

title: Canada's polar bear population plummets - government report
description: Climate change is said to be a key factor in a 27% decline in the population over the past five years.

title: Workers over 50 encouraged to end early retirement
description: It follows a recent report which highlighted early retirement as an issue around a UK labour shortage.

title: Sepsis: 'My life changed eight years ago on Christmas Eve'
description: An amputee says she feels less isolated since she started helping other people who have lost limbs.

title: Ukraine war TikToker's journey to safety in the UK
description: Valeria Shashenok will be spending the festive season in London, not with her loved ones in Ukraine.

title: Akon’s Wakanda, grazing goats and a crumbling crypto dream
description: RnB singer Akon is planning a Senegalese super-city running on cryptocurrency. But will it happen?

title: The countries launching missions to the Moon and beyond in 2023
description: In 2023 several countries will launch missions to the Moon and beyond.

title: The Papers: Covid rages across China and Queen's speech legacy
description: Gender law continues to dominate some front pages as papers preview the King's first Christmas speech.

title: Winter storm's icy blast hits 200 million in US
description: So far at least 12 deaths have been linked to the cold snap, which has brought blizzards and floods.

title: Quiz of the Year, part two: Who wore Marilyn Monroe's dress?
description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?
